attributes.action: support the network of rural and urban post offices by refusing to allow the DTI to close any
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Rural post offices are the lifeline and centre of community in thousands of villages across Great Britain.  Postmasters and postmistresses provide a wide range of official and social services for the communities they serve and are an essential part of community life.  Closure of post offices will result in many people, especially the disadvantaged, elderly and infirm having to travel large distances, often with no public transport, to deal with pensions, parcels and payments.  This is unsatisfactory and closures of thousands of offices must be resisted.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "support the network of rural and urban post offices by refusing to allow the DTI to close any."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12253.asp
